Issues.Title: Check mark of checked MenuItem on ToolBar is not visible
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.302
* Windows version: 19041.388
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019). : No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
Checkbox bakcground color of Checked MenuItem  placed on ToolBar is black.

Aero2 Theme (Windows10 Default Theme / PresentationFramework.Aero2)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57256282/88674046-48491b80-d124-11ea-989c-d08a6b53d787.png)

Aero Theme (PresentationFramework.Aero)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57256282/88686578-31a9c100-d132-11ea-8489-7619a7104504.png)

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Checkbox is filled with black and the check mark is not visible

 **Expected behavior:**
Specify an appropriate color to `ToolBarMenuCheckFill`.

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/8920b2d117e115edbb793fbe8bde28c8a36e3b2d/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/Themes/XAML/ToolBar.xaml#L280

 **Minimal repro:**
```xaml
<ToolBarTray>
    <ToolBar>
        <Menu>
            <MenuItem Header="Menu">
                <MenuItem Header="CheckedMenuItem" IsCheckable="True" IsChecked="True"/>
            </MenuItem>
        </Menu>
    </ToolBar>
</ToolBarTray>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Check mark of checked MenuItem on ToolBar is not visible" (#3287)

Issues.Title: WPF Conversion issue to .NET Core 3.1
Issues.Body:
We are converting a large commercial WPF application over to .NET Core 3.1 and have run into a problem that I'm not sure how to resolve.   

```error CS0433: The type 'ListBoxChrome' exists in both 'PresentationFramework.Aero, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' and 'PresentationFramework.Aero2, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'```

 This error happens in .NET Core because by default it pulls in ALL of the WPF assembles as references.  Unfortunately, both PresentationFramework.Aero and PresentationFramework.Aero2 assemblies define the **same class** under the **same namespace**.

Our xaml namespace looks like this:

```xmlns:mwt="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Themes;assembly=PresentationFramework.Aero"```

I'm assuming the issue is that the C# generated by the "code-behind" process for our xaml, has no way of distinguishing which assembly this comes from as both assemblies use the same namespace.

In .NET Framework, this was never an issue because you had control over which assemblies were referenced by your projects.

How does one workaround this?  

Thanks much,
James
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WPF Conversion issue to .NET Core 3.1" (#3280)

Issues.Title: Why MouseDown event doesn't work for LMB?
Issues.Body: Why MouseDown event [doesn't work](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ONQRPYDmLzhqyrIqiDbxXIO3OJopWPru/view?usp=sharing) for LMB? When I click my button via LMB nothing happens but everything works as expected for MMB and RMB.

Issues.Title: The TreeViewItem cannot stretch correctly
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: all 
* Windows version: all
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No.

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 Usually we can reset the style of the ItemContainer for some controls to reset some properties like HorizontalAlignment, but for TreeView, we can not stretch the TreeViewItem by setting the TreeViewItemContainer. We can find quite a few posts regarding this issue, eg:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47258955/how-to-stretch-treeviewitem-width-to-fill-parent
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16374182/background-in-treeviewitem-not-full-width
https://leecampbell.com/2009/01/14/horizontal-stretch-on-treeviewitems/

The reason has been described in the above post. Because the ControlTemplate of the TreeViewItem has a grid with a 3×2 Grid. 
 The below content is copied from the [post](https://leecampbell.com/2009/01/14/horizontal-stretch-on-treeviewitems/)
> Things to note here is that the layout is controlled with a 3×2 Grid. Now notice that the Border that encapsulates the ContentPresenter (the place holder for where your values will live) is set to live in column 1 (remember 0 based index rules apply here). Also notice that the ItemsPresenter (the place holder for all the children of a TreeViewItem) is set to row 1 and column 1 & 2 (Grid.Column=”1″ Grid.ColumnSpan=”2″). Ok, so now that we know that we look back up to the Grid and notice that the column definitions are such that Column 1 has Width=”Auto” and Column 2 has Width=”*”. This effectively says column 1 can never effectively stretch.
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 Even we reset the style of TreeViewItemContainer to make the `HorizontalAlignment` property as `Stretch`, it will not work because the width of third column is `*`.

 **Expected behavior:**
 The TreeView control should allow users to reset the ItemContainer style to stretch the item.

The reason I raise this issue is for some reason, I need to attach events to the TreeViewItem, eg. tapped, it only works when we click the TextBlock or Image controls in the TreeViewItem. The empty space in the TreeViewItem is not clickable. So we have to find a easy way to make the container to stretch but for this scenario, changing the style of the TreeViewItemContainer will not work.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3395915/88456531-864f0100-ced2-11ea-8b8e-4b5be3aab28f.png)


I think the easiest way is to re-design the layout of the ControlTemplate of the TreeView to allow users stretch the item content. eg. remove the third column and set the column width of column 2 as `*`. Not sure if we have better solutions. Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The TreeViewItem cannot stretch correctly" (#3282)

Issues.Title: Use faster char based overload of String.IndexOf
Issues.Body:
- In dotnet/runtime#13339 I found that due to our changes to use icu by default there was a significant regression in Baml parsing time in .NET 5.0
- There is a plan to address most, if not all of that regression, but it won't be as good as simply using the char based IndexOf
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use faster char based overload of String.IndexOf" (#3278)

Issues.Title: WPF .NET Core no touch behavior support
Issues.Body:
I’ve used WPF Framework for years and started a .NET Core 3.1 app. My first obstacle there doesn’t appear to be any touch screen behavior support that Framework did. This seems odd considering functions like touch translate and zoom are common. VS 2019 Blend shows the behavior, but doesn’t allow it to added. When the solution is loaded back in VS the dependency for interactivity that Blend added has warning/error icon. 
Has .NET Core implemented a different class or tool to support a common function of touch translate, pan and zoom with the fluid inertia effects that Framework did?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WPF .NET Core no touch behavior support" (#3264)

Issues.Title: High Contrast doesn't work well by default
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
.NET 5.0 preview 6
* Windows version: (`winver`)
19041
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No
Haven't tried/can't try
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019).
No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 Text is not visible after enabling High Contrast Mode. This is a regular WPF app using default themes/settings. It is not doing anything special for High Contrast. 

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 Text is not visible after enabling high contrast mode


 **Expected behavior:**
 Text should be visible after enabling high contrast mode
 **Minimal repro:**
Install NuGet Package Explorer from Store (or compile from GitHub at https://github.com/NuGetPackageExplorer/NuGetPackageExplorer)
1. Deploy OS.
2. Perform Store Updates.
3. Install the application from Store.
4. Launch the application.
5. Enable High contrast mode.
6. Observe.
![Screenshot_Repro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1427284/87972814-8d6ead00-ca95-11ea-8d6d-bd9719b25d55.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "High Contrast doesn't work well by default" (#3273)

Issues.Title: WPF pdbs should use SourceLink
Issues.Body:
WPF commit https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/commit/847da8f
Windows 10 2004 19041.388

When debugging into WPF (PresentationFramework.pdb) the .pdb doesn't seem to have source information (SRCSRV record missing):
C:\SymbolCache\presentationframework.pdb\DC5C86C0059149FB80B01E9F5873E6AB1\presentationframework.pdb

WPF should use SourceLink so that the .pdbs are stamped with the links back to GitHub.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF pdbs should use SourceLink" (#3270)

Issues.Body:
This pull request updates the following dependencies

## Coherency Updates
